subject: Technology
title: Content Moderation: An Impossible Task
description: A micro-lesson that makes Content Moderation: An Impossible Task usable.

hook.text: Facebook has 3 billion users posting millions of items per minute. Moderating all that content is literally impossible.

buildup.text: Platforms employ tens of thousands of human moderators and AI systems to review flagged content.

discovery.text: Human moderators view graphic violence, abuse, and extremism all day. PTSD rates among them are alarmingly high.

twist.text: AI moderation struggles with context, sarcasm, and cultural nuance. It over-removes harmless content and misses harmful content.

climax.text: Every moderation decision angers someone: too much censorship or too little. There is no right amount.

punchline.text: Moderating the internet is a job nobody can do well. Somebody has to try anyway.

quiz.question: Why does AI content moderation struggle?
options: AI is too slow to process content
It can't understand context, sarcasm, and cultural nuance
